Mary Evans.Action: Admiringly gazes at Clark Gable's picture and plays a romantic scene to his photo, expressing affection in a playful manner.
Carefully applies lipstick and dresses in a modish but inexpensive manner that aligns with movie star fashion, showing attention to appearance and aspiration.
Cuts out a picture of Clark Gable from a fan magazine and gazes admiringly at it, indicating idealization rather than practical engagement.
Pins pictures of various stars on her mirror, including Clark Gable, showing organized admiration but possibly escapism.
Plays a scene to Clark Gable's photo, adopting a decided Garbo voice and manner, indicating imaginative acting skills and confidence in mimicry.
Gives a quarter to a man asking for carfare, encouraging him at the same time ('Don’t forget the little girl that gave you a start.')
Speaks toughly and departs with a grand manner after playful affectionate words ('you great big, handsome lug!')
Stoops to recover purse she accidentally dropped, looks down and somewhat deflated.
Steps into the footprints of a famous star and imagines her own name there, then sees the janitor erase the prints and her name.
Passes casual greeting 'Hello, cold cuts' to an employee at the counter.
Drops her purse and looks down while stooping to recover it, appearing clumsy or inattentive.
Stands on the cement block with footprints of a star and imagines her name replacing the star's, showing aspirational but passive behavior.

Passes by various people without engaging, simply says 'Hello, cold cuts' in passing.
Calls Nick a 'heel' but then jokes about her sticking around because of a 'great beeg love' for him.

Refuses Muto's inappropriate advances firmly and confidently, threatening to expose his unethical behavior.
Engages politely and confidently with older women, expressing optimism about her future in movies.

Confidently shares inside information about industry trends with others, showing openness and willingness to engage.
